Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Linguist208
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel as part of a package deal, and we paid everything through the deal agent. I sent the hotel an email directly, letting them know that this trip was a 15th anniversary present, and that anything they could do to make it special would be appreciated. When we arrived, they had no record of our reservation. Disaster, we thought. But the very nice receptionist (whose name unfortunately escapes me) told us there would be no problem, and gave us a room. She said they knew the deal company, and since *I* had a confirmation, they'd accept that and straighten things out with the company. When I asked if they had gotten my email, she looked in the file, found it, and after reading it, took our keys back... and gave us another (I imagine nicer) room. The room was lovely. It was on the small side, cozy, really, but immaculate and clearly recently renovated. We had a view of the street, and if we stuck our heads out the window we could see the Bastille column at the end of the road. We went out for some sightseeing and dinner, and when we came back there was a lovely bottle of Champagne waiting for us with a nice note. Breakfast the next morning was quite nice, a basic continental. We checked at the desk, and found that they had contacted the agent whom we had booked the trip through, and everything was resolved. This was really a most enjoyable stay. Although we didn't have much interaction with the staff, whenever we did it was clear that their intent was that we didn't worry about anything, and they would make sure everything went smoothly. That's a most refreshing attitude from any hotel staff, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Lawrence
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a long weekend and this hotel did not disappoint! We booked this hotel on the day of arrival, had a great last minute deal and were not expecting to be so surprised. Great location, lovely room, nice service and a great view onto Place de la Bastille. Would recommend this hotel any day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LarsDane
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two night with a colleague during a trade fair in Paris. The year before we stayed somewhere else in Paris (near the old Opera), but had become fond of the area around Bastille (the new Opera) and had decided to try out something there. This was a really nice surprise. The rooms are not large compared to rooms other places in the world, bus are relatively large compared to other hotels in Paris. The bathroom is also large - two sinks, bathtub and a good shower head. Everything was nice and clean - and I highly recommend the beds. The mattresses are excellent, and I slept like a log both nights. Even the traffic noise from the relatively busy boulevard below I did not hear, due to the efficient double glazing. The neighbourhood is bustling with bistros, restaurants and bars - and I consider it very safe. Just near is the more upbeat Marais neighbourhood, which once was a more modest worker's residential area, but it has been gentrified into a very high-toned place. It's just a 5 minutes walk to the Bastille metro station - and from there it's all of Paris within a very short time. The breakfast is OK, although 14€ is a bit steep for the selection. Due to the limited space, the buffet is almost non-existent, but a very helpful lady passes around the cheese, cold cuts and coffee. As there are many small café's around, you can also try you luck and go local - it's recommendable. On Thursdays, there's a large market on the middle of the boulevard - if I didn't have to go home the same day I could have indulged in the delicious food you could get there - not to say all the other necessities on sale here - try it! All in all Marais Bastille is recommendable - and as the trade fair is a returning event, I'll most likely also be returning to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stuart M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our weekend in Paris. The location was close to the Metro and there was a lot to see and do in the surrounding area. When we arrived at the hotel, the staff we extremely helpful and were always willing to help us with any questions we had regarding attractions or places to eat. We staying in a superior double room and it was a very spacious and comfortable room. The bed was really comfortable and the bathroom was huge with twin sinks. The room was extremely clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the Bastille region of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust789
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 8 month old baby. As this was her first trip abroad, we were worried that the hotel would not be able to provide a cot or have a kettle in the room. (We've read reviews of parisien hotels being smallish in size and not having any tea/coffee making facilities in the room.) However, our worries were unfounded. The staff were friendly and helpful. And I think it was the owver Mr Dolbeau we met several times during our stay who always had a friendly greeting. We had a cot ready in the room and every morning at breakfast she had a comfortable and clean high chair. We had a room at the front of the hotel and it was lovely being able to look out at the street below. Good location; lots of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds - great location”
Reviews.Author: bf_beach
Reviews.Content: This is a very good 3 star hotel. The rooms and common areas were spotless and most important the bed was very comfortable. Unusual for Paris our bathroom was quite large with 2 sinks and ample shower space. We booked a superior room which was well worth the price. Location is very good, 1 block from Merto line 5, 3 blocks from Place du Vosges and 2 blocks from lots of restaurants in the Bastille.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected :-D”
Reviews.Author: Tezoro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two different hotels while in Paris, 3 nights at BW Marais Bastille and 5 nights at the Palais de Chaillot near Trocadero. Although Trocadero is a better location for most tourist sites if you are walking, BW Marais Bastille would be my choice for a return visit. The metro is right across the street, and there were several little restaurants, grocery stores, fast food, and a Starbucks close by. Although not spacious, the room was larger by comparison to the other, had more storage space, plus a safe and a mini fridge. The hotel always seemed very clean and quiet, and I preferred the warm cozy botique hotel atmosphere here. The staff was very accommodating at both hotels, but BW checked us in early and really seemed to go out of their way for us. This definitely was not what I expected, but better!

Reviews.Title: “Don't change a winning Team!”
Reviews.Author: DetDoll
Reviews.Content: Again back to Hotel Marais Bastille for 3 days at Christmas. It was just gorgeous as our first stay last year's stay in Spring. Tastefully Xmas Decoration of the cosy lobby... Thank you to the staff, especially Ms Safia, Mr Idriss, Borine and Managers Mr & Mrs Dolbeau. Room quality are improving more and more, no noise at all and very quite, even rooms on the street side. For foreign tourists, cross over Boulevard Lenoir towards the Quartier du Sentier, rue des francs Bourgeois, Rue des Rosiers, Place des Vosges which is one of the most attractive part of Paris! The Champs Elysees were very disappointing this year! Enjoy your next trip to Paris and staying at Hotel Marais Bastille... D. Doll

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: STEVEGO89
Reviews.Content: The room is small but is not a problem. It's all clean, amazing staff, and the position of the hotel is near 200m to the "Braguet-Sabin" metro station!!! If i come back to paris i'll return to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL for New Yorkers!”
Reviews.Author: wbnyc10002
Reviews.Content: Incredible staff who allowed us to check in 7am without paying for an extra night, made all our dinner reservations for us before we arrived and were so helpful during our stay. Hotel was clean, staff was friendly, breakfast was delicious and fresh. The neighborhood is full of locals, with shopping and eating and you're right on a main subway line for transportation to the tourist spots. I would recommend to anyone, and never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: 2happycampers2
Reviews.Content: This was our first time here as our usual haunts were full. It was really very good. Apart of course from the usual teeny tiny room, but that's what you expect in Paris. And the sliding door to the ensuite leaves little to the imagination if one is sharing the room! However it was clean, bright, warm, comfortable , stylish and friendly. The metro is two minutes walk, but you can walk to the heart of the Marais and Place des Vosges in fifteen minutes. Designer shops such as Merci are also within ten minutes walk. Breakfast was very organised, to the extent that you are served helpings of cheese,meat and yogurt, rather than them being available at the buffet. Cuts down on waste I suppose. There is an attractive (but small) lobby area where several papers and magazines are available to read or take away. Lots of books too. It was too cold to use the (small) patio area but it looked nice. There was a lift beside our door, but a second door had been fitted so there was no noise at all. Larger, posher hotels could take note of this.Very thoughtful We could not fault this hotel and would stay here again. I would be very happy to stay there alone, no dodgy aspects to the hotel or the area.

Reviews.Title: “As big a bargain as you'll find in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Snapper59
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week and was more than satisfied. The train from the airport to Gare du Nord to the subway stop outside (Brequet-Sabin or something) was easy for the light luggage traveler. The rooms were acceptable, no complaints at all. Only quibble is that I thought the breakfast was comp'd and it was not and fortunately I only used it 3-4 times for the week, had I known - there is a Starbucks right around the corner and the breakfast at the hotel was mediocre at best - runny eggs and cold cuts. It was the first hotel I've ever stayed at in Paris with complimentary WiFi and it worked fine for 2 laptops and 2 Iphones in the room all going at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly Hotel, near the Marais”
Reviews.Author: Tiburtina
Reviews.Content: I was booked in this hotel by a research institute nearby in the Marais part of Paris. I had a single room on the sixth floor, pretty small, but clean with a new bathroom. Though the room was really tiny there was everything needed there. Unfortunately the free Wifi didn't work in the room, but I could do without it. The breakfast was not included in the price, but in comparison to other hotels in Paris I stayed at, really good, with fresh fruit salad and tasty coffee - the service lady was of a rare kindness and so friendly, always making sure I had everything I wished. I'm sure I would come back to this hotel also on a private trip.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mareku
Reviews.Content: I spend many years traveling weekends to Paris and ended up either disappointed in the quality of the hotel I stayed or in the outrageous prizes of some establishments. Until that is I found the Best Western Hotel Marais. The rooms are big and light. The beds perfect, the bathroom new. This isn't a hotel with a huge lounge and trendy and hip people - but when you need that, the marais is full of such places. This is the best place to sleep and relax and to get a perfect breakfast in the morning. Staff is very helpful. Location is fine, very close to the Metro and a public garage. Sometimes the pictures on a hotel website over promise - but here they are a true and reliable picture of the real stuff.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Angelo D
Reviews.Content: As we approach the hotel coming from the airport, we didn't really know what to expect. We haven't gone around the Marais part of Paris before. We arrive at the hotel and immediately notice the number of restaurants, cafes, brasseries close to the hotel. You will find Thai, African, Moroccan, Vietnamese, Chinese, and more! It is only one block away from a small supermarket. Small grocery stores abound. The Bastille is about 4 blocks away and right next to it is the Metro. The hotel is cozy with a very friendly and helpful staff. We had no problems at all staying at the hotel for a week. I highly recommend this hotel. - A. Dulay

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sallyann B
Reviews.Content: I visited paris in June with my friend to celebrate her birthday and found this hotel online. I was a little hesitant until we arrived there as i usually stay in 5 star hotels. I actually do not have a negative thing to say about this hotel. It was perfect for our short break. Convenient and easy to get to from Gare de Nord by metro. Friendly staff and very clean rooms, bathrooms and lobby. The room did not look that big but there was plenty of space inside. Complimentary breakfast was a nice start to the day although i wouldn't recommend their scrambled eggs. Bastille is a great location with plenty of places to eat and drink, or not to far to travel for everything else. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: PDX-World
Reviews.Content: Over a number of years Iâ€™ve been to Paris more times than I can count. For the last 18 years Iâ€™ve always stayed near La Bastille. This was our first stay at the Best Western Hotel Marais Bastille, but it certainly wonâ€™t be our last! This hotel is a little gem, and everything about its design and service is thoughtful. We stayed in a double room which we found to be of good size for a three-star hotel in Paris. The double room has a shower, whereas the superior rooms have a bathtub/shower as well as a small sofa. There are few places in the world where hotels are as busy as Paris. It came as a wonderful surprise, therefore, to find our hotel room, as well as that of our traveling companion, absolutely spotless. Not only were the rooms clean, they are clearly very well maintained. Add to this a very comfortable bed with crisp sheets and a duvet, and one couldnâ€™t ask for more! Breakfast is served just off the lobby, at street level, in a bright, cheery space and includes a good selection of breakfast goodies. The multi-lingual staff is both helpful and accommodating. Idriss and Cecile, both at the reception desk, always greeted us with smiles and seemed genuinely interested in our stay in their great city. What more can I say? Weâ€™ll be back in Paris very soon, and weâ€™ll definitely stay at the Best Western Hotel Marais Bastille!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: jojoChandler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. Rooms are compact with lots of amenities, immaculately clean, wonderful staff & delicious breakfast. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to the Marais district, the Metro, Notre Dame, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive - but this is Paris!”
Reviews.Author: CCScotland
Reviews.Content: Finding a nice hotel in Paris without breaking the bank isn't easy; this hotel fits the "nice" category but isn't "fab", and like most Paris hotels is breathtakingly expensive for what you get. The rooms are small but well equipped. The shower was good and the bed was comfy, and the decoration is modern. Breakfast much better than you normally get in a French hotel, with cheese, scrambled eggs, yogurt and a good buffet. On the downside, the breakfast room was tiny and my hot chocolate was stone cold - apparently I asked for it that way...the staff seemed a bit frazzled. Also I've never before had to leave my key at the desk when it's a keycard - isn't the point of those that you don't have to? However these are minor irritations, I'm not wildly enthusiastic about the hotel but it's in an excellent location, has free Wi-Fi and the staff were mostly friendly, so I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Best Western traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay, the hotel is very cute, little but well decorated. Wonderful people working there! Allways ready for giving a hand. The room was little but had everything you needed. The breakfast was not included but very good!

Reviews.Title: “Should be a 4* hotel not 3*. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Ukukukuk1416
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and can honestly say we don't have anything bad to say. The rooms are compact yet have everything needed in them, modern design, comfortable beds, slept like a log! We were in room 56 at the back of the hotel which was extremely quiet. The hotel is a few minutes walk to the Marais. The staff were both friendly and helpful. We paid 140 Euros a night, which was a bargain for the location compared to others in the area of a similar style and comfort level. Our only criticism is that it's a 3* and should be a 4* hotel! Well done Best Western and its staff, will come again.

Reviews.Title: “True Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: B H
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay in Paris at this hotel. Good location and easy access to Metro. Although we had some problems with the aircon, the manager was kind enough to make it all okay for us so we enjoyed our stay at this clean, redone hotel. I find it is unusual to have management truly apprecate your business and do all they can to accomodate you.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great for getting around the city”
Reviews.Author: laura s
Reviews.Content: Found this a great location to stay. Close to a metro stop and easy to get around the city. Not my first trip to Paris its a beautiful city in the Autumn and my trip this time was a mix of work and pleasure. Have stayed at these Best Westerns before and always find a good solid choice with a similar standard around Europe. Clean linen and modern bedroom style, staff were fine they are a bit frosty in Paris but it wouldn't be the same without them ! Good value and the Sunday market is right outside. Could easily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy location clean modern fresh rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jonathangamble
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly. Location was good, close to Bastille, road fairly noisy but not a bad thing as it added to the atmosphere. Room was a good size for Paris. Room was very clean. Nice bed lovely sheets.shower and bathroom excellent. Relaxed atmosphere and I would recommend it as a short stay city break.

Reviews.Title: “Very thinny walls. The noise will destroy your holidays. Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: alexzh1
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we decided to book this hotel. What a mistake! I really cannot understand how this hotel got range 102 in tripadvisor. Many reviews are absolutely insignificant. For me the most important thing is to have a good sleep. In this hotel you cannot sleep after 6.30 AM in the morning. Doors bangs permanently and very strong, you can hear your neighbor taking shower etc.. A really nightmare. I was so tired during the day that i could not enjoy my days in paris. I really don't care about breakfast and all the small points like decoration etc..For me the most important thing is a good bed, a good sleep and staff performance. The employees are not well trained are unmotivated. Very bad english and not helpfull at all. The rooms are so small that you don't have any space for big 2 big cases. When you see the pictures in internet do you have the feeling the size is ok. Good photoshop!! Breakfast staff don't speak any english and expect from you french knowledge. Very typical for Paris. Koffee is horrible and they charge you for one expresso. Very picky! In the morning you have to wait almost 5 minutes for this slow and small elevator. You can pay at least 50 euros less in one much better hotel middle in Marais. You need to walk at least 20 minutes to be in the middle of Marais. This hotel it's near Bastille not near Marais. I use to travel frequently to Paris. This is my first visit to Best Western Marais and for sure the last one. Sure you cannot wait to much for a 3 star hotel but privacy is essential. Yours travel angel.

Reviews.Title: “Useful, quiet area, overpriced room.”
Reviews.Author: Lourdes C
Reviews.Content: It's a nice and quiet area, in front of Breget Sabin metro station. Room are clean and when superior (my case) comfortable. Begining fall they turned off the AC and we had to open the windows, the street noise can be a problem and a sewer smell coming from outside into the room (first floor) pretty strong sometimes. Reception is small but staff really helpful and nice. Never tried breakfast as there are so many places around for this ( and cheaper). I think the room is overpriced but it seems in Paris everything is. Hop on Hop off buses can be take at Bastille Square 5 min walk. Thursday and Sunday market in the Boulevard in front the hotel are a nice touch, even though when they leave the street stays smelling fishy. Taxis from Airport to there about 40 EUR and 15 EUR from any mayor atraction. Bastille square on weekends is full of people enjoying themselves and the hotel is super for enjoying that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Luka150
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was what I was looking for: Great location, clean and confort room, elevator (I was travelling with small children). On main street but very quiet. I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located close to Metro & Busses”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyRehctub
Reviews.Content: A great medium priced small hotel, ideally located for Eastern Paris. The Hotel was easily accessible from CDG Airport by train on the RER to Gare du Nord, then by metro to Breguet Sabin station that is only a very short walk to the Hotel. The Hotel was newly decorated, clean, with contemporary furniture and fittings. We had a delightful front facing bedroom onto the street, that may be a problem if you are VERY sensitive to street traffic noise, but expect that you could ask for a rear room if this could be a problem. The early morning traffic noise was not a problem for us. The English speaking staff were courteous and always helpful. Good breakfast with the choice of scrambled or boiled eggs or continental breakfasts. There is no dinner service. Plas de la Bastille is a short walk, as is the Maris district, both areas have a wide variety of cafes & restaurants. We walked to Notre Dame, Louvre and Musee d'Orsay, a fair walk but you can catch a 69 bus back to Plas de la Bastille. On Sunday mornings there is an amazing outdoor food market just down from the Hotel - well worth a visit. I would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel to friends and family, sensibly priced through o'tel web site on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, personal, recommended...”
Reviews.Author: Espritcat
Reviews.Content: Traveling with 3 college friends... a really nice small hotel... modern decor and facilities... clean, white beds, slate bathroom, very complete breakfast, from cold cuts and cheese to cereal and eggs... and every pastry and bread is memorable. Our rooms overlooked the interior courtyard with 2 large windows... enjoyed this, and hear that there are outside rooms with cityviews. Fluffy beds, big TV , everything very pleasant. Front desk always on to help, make suggestions and travel arrangements. Walk across the plaza to Metro, 2 blocks to Bastille center. Sunday market stands in the center of the boulevard. Highly recommend this hotel as a charming place to stay, near trains, restaurants, even walk 2K to Notre Dame... Will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location and GREAT value!”
Reviews.Author: madlvr79
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a last minute hotel in a great location, but at a great value. I certainly found it with this hotel! It is a great location - literally right next to a metro stop, so you can go anywhere in the city! It was on the outside of the Marais, so you'll have to walk a little to get into the heart of the Marais, but I didn't mind as the walk is easy and it is a great area to walk through. Room was standard - nothing spectacular, but it was clean and had everything I needed. The staff was super attentive and was very helpful with everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “'brilliant little hotel'”
Reviews.Author: Gill14
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Paris (15/9/11 - 17/9/11) to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and everything exceeded our expectations. This hotel is a little gem. It is situated very close to the Bastille and metro stations with lots of shops, bars, cafes etc in the area. We walked towards the river and then across to Notre Dame and back again through little streets packed with pavement cafes quaint little shops and loads of interesting buildings. We stayed in room 64 which is on the top floor (6th) and we had a little balcony with a view over the roof tops and we could see the eiffel tower which was fantastic. At night it is all lit up and on the hour for a couple of minutes, it sparkles. We were in Paris for only two nights and the first night, we saw the tower from our balcony, the second night, we were sat on the grass along with hundreds of other people, right by the tower watching it light up and sparkle right in front of us. Breakfast was lovely, plenty of choice and served by a lovely lady who was really friendly and welcoming. On our first morning, I went down very early and asked for some tea. I was expecting a kettle and tea bags etc, but the nice lady actually made me a pot of tea which I then took back up to our room. We went down later for breakfast. All the staff on the reception desk were very helpful. On our first morning, it was a lady who was very friendly and efficient, she was also there on our last morning and helped us with metro directions to Gare du Nord for the Eurostar when a massive parade/demo completely gridlocked the streets so a taxi was out of the question. There was also a gentleman there and on the second day, two younger ladies. All the staff were kind, friendly and helpful. All in all, we had a fantastic few days and could not have asked for more. Our first and last impressions of this hotel, were good and would certainly have no hestitation in recommending this one. Thank you to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: Buffshot
Reviews.Content: Paris hotels rooms at a reasonable price level tend to be minute and often poorly decorated. This hotel offers reasonably spacious rooms which have been recently well renovated. Rooms are bright and clean with plenty of hanging space, decent well designed bathrooms, a mini safe and free wi-fi. Rooms on the main street may be a little noisy, but who travels without ear plugs these days? Breakfasts are perfectly decent continental style.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: IanFerg
Reviews.Content: I used booking.com to book the room and paid just over 100 euros per night, well below the rack rate and the Travel Advisor average. Some reviewers here and elsewhere had some issues with room size but it was fine for a single person or a couple. Let's face it you shouldn't be spending too much time in the room anyway. Easy access to the Marais and multiple Metro lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Fabio Z
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at this hotel for a five night stay. Very good location right near the Bastille monument and metro. rooms were clean, modern and comfortable. It has airconditioning and sound proofed windows we had a balcony to look over towards the road and park. You can get a room at the back of the hotel not on the road side so that would be quieter but you would not get a view. Great rate for five nights, Highly recommend this hotel as its not right in the centre of town but close enough to get to it by walk and with the great paris metro. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shazza4024
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this great hotel for 3 nights. Our room on the fourth floor exceeded our expectations, it was comfortable, spacious and had a nice view over the Blvd du Richard Lenoir. The air con worked great too which was just what you needed after a hot day exploring Paris. The breakfast was plentiful, fruit salad, cereals, ham, cheese, eggs, bread, croissants and pastries......tea, coffee, hot chocolate, juices.......certainly enough to keep you going for a good few hours! The staff were always around to assist if required, there was always a friendly face to welcome us. The hotel is within walking distance of Notre Dame and the Seine and within easy reach of Place du Vosges which is a few streets away. We found plenty of reasonably priced restaurants in the area too, though drinks seem to be expensive whichever bar you go to. The Cafe d'Industrie located in a street behind the hotel is a great venue, the food was reasonably priced and the service great too. Another restaurant we would recommend is Chez Clement, located on Blvd Beaumarchais (10 min walk) offered a two course set menu including a drink for only 13.90 Euros each during August, not much choice but good quality food. A slightly cheaper bar for drinks is the Cafe Martini which is located near Place du Vosges. Here you can buy "almost a pint" of Stella for 5 Euros, whereas most other bars charge you anywhere from 6-8 Euros. The location is really convenient for access from the Gare du Nord, but also for access to the Metro. I would definitely recommend staying here if you want a comfortable reasonably priced hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: julietming
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated, the rooms are very clean, new and nice! Location isn't too bad either, next to 2 different metro lines. Travelling around was so hassle free. WIFI is free but unfortunately Viber doesn't seem to work on their WIFI. But there is no issue with Skype. Not exactly the cheapest but the hotel is newly renovated, so most definitely a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevie1963
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend (3 nights) and what a perfect experience it turned out to be. Superbly clean room with a very comfortable bed, flat screen Tv and a superb bathroom. Breakfast was a continental type with good quality food and you could eat as much as you liked. The staff were all very friendly and helpful with directions, advice on places to eat and booking excursions for us. I can't rate this hotel high enough other than to say we will be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Holidayloveee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my partner for a city break in Paris. The hotel has been recently refurbished to a very high standard. Rooms like most in Paris are on the average/small side but nicely decorated and clean, the air conditioning was a blessing! The shower was fantastic, very roomy and worked a treat. We felt very safe in the area and didn't worry about walking back of an evening. Hotel is a short walk from the Bastille where there are lots of restaurants and plenty to do and just a 10 minute walk to the seine. If youre looking for good food we can highly reccomend the Blues BBQ resturant just around the corner, great prices and really tasty food! There is a metro station nearby so getting around couldn't be easier. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough all of the staff were more than pleasant and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful little hotel for our family”
Reviews.Author: MaxTeej
Reviews.Content: Idris, Cecile and the rest of the staff were so accommodating! We arrived very early in the morning, on the second leg of our vacation, from a very warm country and a tad unwell. We decided that, even though check in was not until, 1pm we would head straight to the hotel. They immediately served up coffee and croissants even though we didn't have a room to bill it to yet, and we rested in the comfortable lounge area (which felt like someones living room) until our rooms were ready (10:30 am). They offered us more cups of coffee "while we waited so long" :-) They explained that they would get the rooms done as soon as possible so we could go upstairs and relax. ANd that is exactly what they did. The rooms are small but exceptionally clean, and the location is within close proximity to great little restaurants, cafes, bars and supermarkets. Our room faced out on the street and park and was bright, smoke free and cheerful. We bought baguette & pastries from the bakery behind the hotel, and had espresso at l'industrie Cafe with our pastries (like many of the locals) in the morning. You can choose the hotel breakfast (pastries, muesli, baguette, cheese, jam hot drinks) down stairs also. It is a liesurley 20 minute walk to Notre Dame from here and a 40 minute walk up the great shopping street, Rivolli to the Louvre. The metro from Bastille makes all these equally as accessible. There is a bike rental station right near the hotel if you prefer to bike-it around Paris. 2-5 min walk to metro Bastille. A kettle/hot water tea and coffee making supplies can be ordered to the room if you prefer, and there is a small bar fridge to put supplies. The location is quiet, and quite safe and walkable (we walked ten minutes home from Mojito lab late at night with no concerns - in fact the streets were buzzing). The staff were friendly and more than willing to assist with any inquiries, book taxis or show us how to get around via metro. Free WIFI. Seemed to be mostly French/ European and British guests. Would definitely stay here again. Does not feel like a big chain hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately priced, but polished and professional”
Reviews.Author: wmhallberg
Reviews.Content: Located a few hundred yards from the Bastille Opera House on a lovely boulevarde separating Le Maris from Bastille, The Marais Bastille Hotel is a bargain, even if it is not quite a budget choice. It is very close to one of Paris' best kept secrets, the Bastille "Strip," which is rife with funky multi-ethnic restaurants, exuberant street life, music and energy. The hotel itself is very well located near the Bastille Metro stop where many lines converge. An easy walk away is the Latin Quarter and Notre Dame, not to mention Place Des Vosges and the great cafes of Marais, which is less touristed than it adjacent Latin Quarter. My wife and I stayed on the 5th floor, with a great, albeit narrow balcony, great for standing and taking in the joggers and dog walkers, not to mention the vast street market, which, if memory serves, appears on WEdnesdays and Saturdays. Terrific. The rooms are not big, nor small. The shower is tiny, but ultra-chic. Beds are awesome, and the staff who clean the rooms daily are very professional. A/C is a blessing on hot days. Get a room on the top floor, if possible, but any room will do. Desk staff are superb, and will loan you a laptop with internet service for free. Highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for a few tiny things ...”
Reviews.Author: jojno
Reviews.Content: The hotel is run by the nicest hotel people we have met for ages. Everyone, without exception, is helpful and warm. (Probably pushing the review up a star.) The location is OK - about a block down from the Bastille column, right on the outskirts of the Marais district so a bit of a walk but not too far. The drawbacks are tiny: somewhat charmless decor (probably dictated by Best Western) ... towels the size of postage stamps ... no coffee or hot water in the room ... no ice (which everyone seems to feel is an odd request) and no chairs on the tiny balcony. All in all a good, reasonably priced place. (Oh and don't bother with the breakfast, it is very ordinary and there are much better options in the coffee shops around the area.)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: scarthingwell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marais Bastille from the 25 to 27th July. We had room 11 which was on the first floor and couldn't fault the room. It was decorated lovely and the bathroom was excellent, fabulous shower. The people who worked there, were very pleasant, and I wouldn't hesitate to go back to this hotel. There is a metro over the road which is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little friendly hotel - We can't fault it !”
Reviews.Author: sue_clare
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel - in a very convenient location - close to a Metro staion, and within easy walking distance of Bastille ,and the Marais area - especially Place de Vosges, which we love. The room was very comfortable- recently refurbished, very modern. Beds very comnfortable - and our room was exceedingly quiet ,for a city centre hotel ( it was at the back). The staff were very friendly and helpful, and there was a good breakfast. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jerry075
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights - the rooms were modern and clean, and the friendly staff were always willing to help out with advice, restaurant bookings etc. The Marais district is great - would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris and looking for a reasonably priced room. Hard to fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ula8
Reviews.Content: New accomodations, good location - few minutes from Marais and Bastille and great service. Staff delivered outstanding service, specially Philippe, chief of reception, who's always ready to solve customer's problems and answer doubts. Merci Beaucoup Philippe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth19810
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris for a mini break and found this hotel to be perfect. The hotel itself was very clean and tidy, it's just had a re-vamp, and the decor was simple, modern and fresh. The staff were really lovely and friendly, the owner, reception staff and even the cleaners had a jolly smile and 'hello'. Having visited Paris before many times, staying central by the Louvre, I was thrilled with this location. It's right smack bang between Bastille and Le Marais. We drank in the lively bars in Bastille, and found a great little trendy party area, friendly young creatives, a great place to people watch and have fun. We also shopped the many shops in Le Marais, and loved the vintage and antique shops especially, this felt more fun and relaxed than the centre of Paris which can be a bit manic and pricey. We love walking, and so found this area fine for getting about, we walked down to the river, and in and out of the little lanes, and enjoyed every moment! We also bought a two day Batobus pass and jumped on and off the boat to see the sights. On Thursday the market is on, right outside the hotel, so it's a good one to visit if you like your food. We ate a couple of times at Cafe Sully which had gorgeous food, and at La Tartine which is on Rue de Rivoli, which had lovely food, although it was a bit bonkers sitting by such a busy road. I could not speak more highly about the area, and because this hotel is right between two really great spots (especially if you're young and like to see the 'cool' side of a city) it is kind of perfect, and with the lovely service and fab decor we will definitely be going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beverley F
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here (double room) and my bro-in-law (single room) for 3 days sightseeing in Paris early June 2011. Locality is great - near to Breguet Sabin and Bastille metros but also 15 mins walk along the rue St Antoine and rue de Rivoli into the centre of town if you're feeling energetic! The hotel seems to have been recently refurbished and the reception area is colourful and sparkling clean! The reception staff (dealt with 3 different ones over our stay) were all, without exception, super friendly, helpful and went out of their way to assist us in every way. The rooms were great - everything seemed to be new - and cleanliness was impeccable. The bedding was snow white and crisp, the carpets clean and sweet smelling. Extra pillows, plenty of storage. A double door system on the rooms gives good acoustic protection. The shower was just AMAZING. It seemed to be brand new and was super hot and powerful, just the ticket after a long day's sightseeing! The breakfast was served between 0730 and 1030 so civilised times - it was plentiful and typically French with the addition of ham and cheese and boiled eggs for the northern Europeans! The staff who served breakfast in the morning were lovely - smiling and friendly and efficient. All in all, we were more than pleased - delighted in fact - with our stay here and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody staying in Paris for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: tgb89
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent place to stay when visiting Paris. Everything from the service to the cleanliness of the rooms, the comfort of the room to the location were excellent. My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were extremely helpful and welcoming and the room was comfortable clean and nicely renovated. We had a lovely time here and would definitely come back to stay here the next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: LLindqvist
Reviews.Content: We are traveling with our 11 year old son, so we selected a superior room for the extra space. The room was spacious by Paris standards with one king and a single pull out sofa, which they had pulled out and made in preparation of our arrival. The staff here are lovely - very accommodating and friendly. We only ate breakfast one day. It was good, continental. There is no coffee pot in the room, but you can get a small carafe and cups in the lobby eac morning that you can bring to your room. The neighborhood is fantastic -- not touristy, central, with several markets, pharmacies, shops, and restaurants nearby. The Bastille metro station is close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: LLindqvist
Reviews.Content: We are traveling with our 11 year old son, so we selected a superior room for the extra space. The room was spacious by Paris standards with one king and a single pull out sofa, which they had pulled out and made in preparation of our arrival. The staff here are lovely - very accommodating and friendly. We only ate breakfast one day. It was good, continental. There is no coffee pot in the room, but you can get a small carafe and cups in the lobby eac morning that you can bring to your room. The neighborhood is fantastic -- not touristy, central, with several markets, pharmacies, shops, and restaurants nearby. The Bastille metro station is close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: dbrimlow
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I reluctantly booked a room here after my favorite hotels were sold out. But what a wonderful surprise! Sofia at reception let me check in early. Merci! She was very helpful with any questions I had. She is a lovely person. My room (#52) was modern and spotlessly clean. Yes, it was tiny, but we know that! Soundproofing was excellent. All of the housekeeping staff were cheerful. They left me extra towels without being asked. When I decided to extend my stay by another 3 days, the manager was accomodating. Since Roland Garros/French Open was starting, I knew this might be a problem, but it was not. Lovely! Cecile at the front desk helped me book a tour to Giverny and tried to find tickets to Saint-Chapelle for a concert. The staff members make this hotel a wonderful place to stay. I don't want to leave out any of the front desk staff. Two of the other men were also very helpful. Other people have commented on the hotel's closeness to both the #5 line at Breguet-Sabin and down at Bastille, you can catch the always important #1 line. There are boulangeries around the corner and a FranPrix. There is a market across the street on Sunday and Wednesday. I bought shawls, scarves, and fruit there! The hotel and the area are safe. I walked back from a friend's apartment at 10:30 PM and was surprised by the number of other women I saw out. Oh, for women, there is a hairdryer! And I liked having a safe in the room. Can you tell that I had a great stay here? They totally won me over!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic-Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Jamesba1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner and a couple of friends for four nights, on a sightseeing/partying few days in Paris. Booked this hotel as it was in budget, near the side of town we wanted to stay and from recent reviews looked ok for what we wanted. From past experience we expected it to be small and dated as most hotel in Paris can be, but we were completely shocked and excited about the standard of the Best Western Marais Bastille. The rooms were bigger than expected, VERY modern and trendy, and clean and tidy. The staff were lovely and helpful. Continental breakfast was simple and had everything you would expect and need for a breakfast before a long day sightseeing. We could easily walk 10-15 mins to bars in the Marais and a 20 minute walk you are at the Lourvre. There is an authentic food/art market right on the street outside the hotel and 2 mins walk you are at the Bastille, there is a Metro station within a 5 minute walk. So easy. I am airline crew and stay in many hotels around the world, and a lot of the 4 star hotels I have used were not up to the standard we experienced here. FANTASTIC!!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: onemanguy
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time online looking for a nice hotel that wasn't run down, in a good location...Look no further!!! We highly recommend this hotel! It's right beside a METRO station (no. 2 line). The rooms are small but their modern (recently refurbished) with a modern ensuite bathroom, plasma tv, safe. Breakfast was really good. Nice coffee, cheese, ham, fruits, yougharts, croissants and pain au chocolates.cereal. Reception staff were very helpful, even with our poor French. We walked from the hotel to the Eiffel Tower in about an hour (very leisurely pace). Our room was on the 4th floor and we had a lovely little balcony looking over the tree lined street.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION,VERY CLEAN ROOM”
Reviews.Author: smaroGreece
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband,had been in paris for 4 nights from 28 march to 01 april.It was a fantastic experiance,as we have had a very good price from a site,so that we couldn't believe that everything would be ok.We arrived early in the morning,i think at about 11.30 a.m. but our room was ready.We had a room in the second floor and we were very lucky, as only in the second floor the rooms have a balcony ,with a great view in the park in front of the hotel. The room although it was very small,it was very nice decorated ,very clean and the bathroom was also great.The staff ,was very polite and helpful and the breakfast was tasty, having cereals,croissants,yogurts,eggs,cheese,ham ,juices ,and jums.I would sertainly recommend this hotel ,mentioning the great location -very central - and the near by metro station (bastille and breget sabin).

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, poor service, low quality. Price high”
Reviews.Author: GiorgioNapoli
Reviews.Content: I have been at this hotel in March 2011. i choosed it through a website, because it was in a central position, near Place de La Bastille, and had the bran Best Western, that i hoped could guarantee a certain standard of quality. As arrived, they put us in an extremely small room at 6th floor, where there was not even spacve to put outr two luiggages. We asked to have a bigger room, so they put us in a room for disabled people at ground floor, saying it was thwe biggest of the hotel. It was just slightly bigger than the other, and facing the hotel patio, so that was not possible to keep curtains open. The bed was too small for two persons, and there were noises when peopole came in the (small) lobby of the hotel just in front of the room. Nearby was a toilet, so we had the pleasure to hear the sounds. More than one time the waitress opened the room door without knocking. A mid aged guy at the reception was kind and spoke english, but the girls where totally uncooperative, and with the typical sciovinist attitude that you may find in Paris. Hairdryer was not working, but i didn't bother to ask for a change, as did not want to got through hassles. Air conditioning was non existent. Only good thing was the position, but there are better places. It was expensive for the quality offered. I would not return to it. Giorgio

Reviews.Title: “fantastique”
Reviews.Author: MAKENLODGE_11
Reviews.Content: An excellent value for money hotel which is very clean and comfortable and easy to find as it is close to the Bastille Metro line and bus stop. Stayed here for 3 nights and decided to buy a two day pass for the open top bus which cost 32 euros p.p. a great way to see ALL of Paris in a short time. Happy hours start around 4pm in most bars which brings the cost to around 5 euros a pint!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience - wonderful staff and very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRBNYC1113
Reviews.Content: This was a truly amazing hotel. The staff was so lovely and accommodating, always helping out in any way they possibly could. The owner of the hotel, Philippe, was so nice and gave us great recommendations and went out of his way to help us. The rooms were extremely clean and very modern. The hotel is in a great location - near great shopping and restaurants. The price was the best around for such a great area. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there on my next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “great location - but we missed out on a refurbished room”
Reviews.Author: TNMLondon
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel, in a package with good Eurostar train times, so I did initially think it was too good to be true! After referring to my usual tool of trip advisor for the hotel, I decided to book at as there was much more good than bad and at the price, I thought Iâ€™d be a fool not too. Turns out the hotel had undergone a refurbishment in 2010, but this was not extended to the entire hotel, as I was placed in room 64, which had not been refurbished to the standard of all the other rooms which had been widely displayed on the website and on trip advisor. The room had a dated decor, separate toilet to the bathroom, but the strangest thing was the door to the room was hidden behind another door?! very weird. Apart from the room, being incredibly deceiving the hotel was nice. I did try to get moved to a refurbished room, but the hotel was fully booked. The location is perfect for getting the best of both, sightseeing but also enjoying local life, as there is a busy farmers market on a Sunday morning, where you can sample foie gras and cheese. My only complaint is that the room was a total fabrication to what was advertised and that let me down as I thought Iâ€™d be getting a much more modern experience. My advice, don't stay above the 4th floor - as I believe all the rooms below have been refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for a Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TheFunkyDuck
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about this hotel, as it was just a cheap option for a last minute trip to Paris. It is always nice when you are pleasantly surprised. The room was great, very comfy and perfect for a Weekend break. The staff are helpful and happy to see you. Location also is great, you can get around Central Paris on foot (although I like walking, and Paris is quite spread out) or there is a Metro station nearby wherever you are, and only a cole of minutes walk from the hotel. The breakfast is quite basic, cold meats, boiled eggs, bacon etc but still enough to give you a good start to the day. On the Sunday morning, we left the hotel and there was a HUGE market outside, probably over 100 stalls selling everything from gorgeous french cheese wine and olives, to slippers and art. Another great surprise. We walked around the market for about an hour, bought some cheese and bread, walked down to the Seine and had breakfast. A lovely Small friendly hotel that We will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: StHelenafan
Reviews.Content: My partner took me away for a surprise trip to Paris on the August bank holiday and after reading the reviews and seeing the photos on the hotel pre-refurb â€“ I was really really worried. So much so that I called and checked what had actually been done in the refurb. Sure enough, on arrival the hotel looked great â€“ theyâ€™ve done a really good job with the space. Itâ€™s not a big hotel â€“ the rooms and bathrooms are small, but not so small that you canâ€™t swing a cat. We had a little balcony in our room where we could see what was happening all along the leafy street below. The hotel is really close to an underground/metro station and a short stroll (10 mins tops) to some great cafes, bars and restaurants. If you are coming in via Eurostar â€“ itâ€™s really handy as there arenâ€™t any changes once you are on the metro. There is also a little shop right round the corner where you can buy drinks to put in your supplied fridge. The water and Diet Coke that was in the fridge is chargeable but there was no price listing anywhere â€“ I think the bottle of water we had was around 2 euros which I thought was a bit expensive. Breakfast was okay â€“ typical continental stuff but the lady who comes out to take your toast/eggs/hot drinks order is really lovely. If would definitely stay in this place again â€“ we had an excellent time despite the weather being a little bit cold.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely furnished rooms!”
Reviews.Author: palmspr_flyer
Reviews.Content: Arrived early before noon and room was ready. Room was very nice with everything you needed. Had two windows. Nice flat screen TV. Bed was very comfortable with nice linens. Had free wifi in the room too. Bathroom was small, but had a nice walk in shower with a great showerhead. Staff was very helpful, for english speaking customers they were spoke well. Location was good near two Paris Metro stops. Sunday, there was large street market a couple blocks away. Didn't have a breakfast each morning, but the breakfast room was very nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations on a fine refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: daibowen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in November 2009 and again in October 2010, that is, both before and after its refurbishment. We would like to congratulate everyone involved in the stylish makeover. The public areas are colourful yet relaxing, and moving the breakfast-room from the basement to just off reception is a great improvement. In our room we found the same bright furnishings, a very comfortable bed, hot shower, and also the addition of a digital room-safe proved very useful. What had not changed was the friendly and helpful welcome from the proprietors and staff. As other reviewers have commented, the location of the hotel is great for exploring Paris - 3 Metro lines run from Bastile. Exploring on foot, many discoveries can be made alongside the better known attractions, and a surprising amount of ground can be covered e.g. to the Isle St. Louis in about 15mins. We look forward to our next visit to Hotel Marais Bastille, hopefully our base in Paris for many trips to come. Our high scores for this hotel reflect what we would expect of a hotel of this size and rating and we would recommend it to anyone wanting to get out and about in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well-located and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Cyril1
Reviews.Content: This charming 37-room hotel a short walk from the Bastille Metro has just reopened after extensive refurbishment. The public and guest rooms have been tastefully designed and are very comfortable. The owners and staff are particularly welcoming and helpful and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. We booked through HotelConnect.com who recommended it to us and gave a very good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a Hotel in Jewel of a City!”
Reviews.Author: SteveP_10
Reviews.Content: My fiance Gail and I stayed here Sept. 13-19. What a wonderful little hotel in an excellent location near the site of the famous Paris Bastille (destroyed well over a century ago). Newly remodeled, the room was "cozy" but very nicely appointed. The Grohe bathroom fixtures, for example, told me the recent remodelling was not done "on the cheap"! Walking distance to many things including the wonderful Paris Metro that takes you everywhere quickly and cheaply!. Betty and Plillipe, the proprietors, are wonderful, sweet people who want to and do make their guests feel right at home. Next trip to Paris this is our hotel! We spoke French as best we could but the staff is bilingual...a plus. Quiet rooms on a noisy street! A nice thing given we were on Floor 1 facing Blvd. Richard Lenoir. Steve and Gail - Plainfield, IL, USA

Reviews.Title: “Extremely clean, friendly, comfortable, modern hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: londontravelgirl_10
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed here with a friend and was pleasantly surprised by how comfortable and clean it was . It has been newly re-furbished and only opened again in August so everything is spick and span! Staff were very friendly and helpful and let us leave our bags on the last day. The room was light and at the back overlooking a courtyard so it was quiet. The bathroom had a great shower (and bath) and the bed was more comfortable than my own! It's 5 mins walk to Le Marais and I would recommend it if you want a little more comfort than the usual 2 star ' quintessentially French' style hotels. Of course you pay a little more, but we got a good deal online for 3 nights stay and we both agreed it was worth it. You have to ask for tea & coffee making facilities, which they are happy to give you - beware the kettle - although brand new ,it doesn't switch off automatically ! Didn't try the breakfast but dining area looked nice - lots of effort being put in to make it look modern but homely. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, very friendly and helpful stuff, extremely clean, very modern, perfect central location.”
Reviews.Author: Anna186225
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my 7-year-old daughter for two nights in August and was very impressed with it. Stuff was very helpful, extremely friendly and attentive. Room was modern, very quiet and extremely clean. It was hot in Paris, but the room had an air conditioner (with a remote control). It was easy to use the internet in the hotel (to skipe my family in England). On the day of our departure we were offered the left luggage facility in the hotel, so we didn't have to spend time or energy looking for it on the station or walking around town with heavy bags. Location of the hotel is wonderful (couple of minutes from the nearest metro and walking distance to all central attractions). Both me and my daughter were very pleased. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Simple Hotel in the Marais/Bastille Area”
Reviews.Author: ZestfulLiving
Reviews.Content: General Impressions and Staff: Nice location in the Bastille adjacent to the Marais. Directly next to Breguet-Sabin Metro stop. Also close to Bastille metro stop. Pleasant staff that were polite and helpful. Some were warmer than others. They did have an odd rule of insisting that you leave your room key card with them each time you left the hotel. It's not uncommon to drop off your key, but the insistence aspect was a tad strange. Overall, this was a simple, no frills hotel. Room: Small, but comfortable. The same applies for the bathroom. If you can get a room that does NOT face the light well, the better for you. Even though Richard Lenoir is a busy street, I would have preferred to have had a room with more light in it. Our room was quite dark. I will say that they respected my wish not to be near an elevator and that was kind of them to do. The floors are small. There is a charming semi-spiral staircase that connects the floors and suprisingly there are two elevators that service the floors. Get a room that is as far away from the elevators as you can. Bathroom was small, but clean and decent. BTW - House cleaning staff did a nice job each day. Cost: 530 Euro for 4 nights which we thought was reasonable. Breakfast was not included. It costs Euro 13 per person and was NOT good. So, after one breakfast there, we skipped the others and ate out. Also the breakfast room is set up in the hotel "crypt". That means no windows. Not a very nice space. Location: Pretty good and all of Paris was very easily accessible through the Metro system, including RER lines. Get a pass when you get to Paris as you don't want to be buying tickets all the time. Recommend: Yes, as a budget place with no frills and decent location. I would pick differently in the future simply to have a different experience.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Marais Bastille
HotelInfo.Address: 36 Boulevard Richard Lenoir | 11th Arr., 75011 Paris, France
